greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Niven (or Harshad) numbers A005349 divided by the sum of their digits.
link: Carmine Suriano, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: 12 is the 11th term of A005349, hence a(11) = 12/(1+2) = 4.
program: (PARI) lista(nn) = {for (i = 1, nn, if (i % sumdigits(i) == 0, print1(i/sumdigits(i), ", ")););} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Oct 09 2013
xref: Cf. A005349 (Niven (or Harshad) numbers: numbers that are divisible by the sum of their digits). Cf. also A066355.
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Dec 20 2001
ext: Corrected, extended and edited by _Zak Seidov_, Oct 26 2005
